00023 #ifndef LUABIND_ERROR_HPP_INCLUDED
00024 #define LUABIND_ERROR_HPP_INCLUDED
00025 
00026 #include <luabind/prefix.hpp>
00027 #include <exception>
00028 #include <luabind/config.hpp>
00029 #include <luabind/typeid.hpp>
00030 
00031 struct lua_State;
00032 
00033 namespace luabind
00034 {
00035 
00036 #ifndef LUABIND_NO_EXCEPTIONS
00037 
00038         // this exception usually means that the lua function you called
00039         // from C++ failed with an error code. You will have to
00040         // read the error code from the top of the lua stack
00041         // the reason why this exception class doesn't contain
00042         // the message itself is that std::string's copy constructor
00043         // may throw, if the copy constructor of an exception that is
00044         // being thrown throws another exception, terminate will be called
00045         // and the entire application is killed.
00046         class LUABIND_API error : public std::exception
00047         {
00048         public:
00049                 explicit error(lua_State* L): m_L(L) {}
00050                 lua_State* state() const throw() { return m_L; }
00051                 virtual const char* what() const throw()
00052                 {
00053                         return "lua runtime error";
00054                 }
00055         private:
00056                 lua_State* m_L;
00057         };
00058 
00059         // if an object_cast<>() fails, this is thrown
00060         // it is also thrown if the return value of
00061         // a lua function cannot be converted
00062         class LUABIND_API cast_failed : public std::exception
00063         {
00064         public:
00065                 cast_failed(lua_State* L, type_id const& i): m_L(L), m_info(i) {}
00066                 lua_State* state() const throw() { return m_L; }
00067                 type_id info() const throw() { return m_info; }
00068                 virtual const char* what() const throw() { return "unable to make cast"; }
00069         private:
00070                 lua_State* m_L;
00071                 type_id m_info;
00072         };
00073 
00074 #else
00075 
00076         typedef void(*error_callback_fun)(lua_State*);
00077         typedef void(*cast_failed_callback_fun)(lua_State*, type_id const&);
00078 
00079         LUABIND_API void set_error_callback(error_callback_fun e);
00080         LUABIND_API void set_cast_failed_callback(cast_failed_callback_fun c);
00081         LUABIND_API error_callback_fun get_error_callback();
00082         LUABIND_API cast_failed_callback_fun get_cast_failed_callback();
00083 
00084 #endif
00085 
00086         typedef int(*pcall_callback_fun)(lua_State*);
00087         LUABIND_API void set_pcall_callback(pcall_callback_fun e);
00088         LUABIND_API pcall_callback_fun get_pcall_callback();
00089 
00090 }
00091 
00092 #endif // LUABIND_ERROR_HPP_INCLUDED
